contentrichtext.text: {{Italic title prefixed|3}} '''USS ''Doyle''''' has been the name of at least three ships in the United States Navy. * [[USS Richard Doyle (DMS-34)|USS ''Doyle'' (DD-494/DMS-34)]], a [[Gleaves class destroyer|''Gleaves''-class]] [[destroyer]], from 1943â€“45, then a fast minesweeper until 1955. Named for [[Richard Doyle (sailor)|Richard Doyle]], who fought during the [[First Barbary War|Barbary Wars]] and was killed while in service in 1807. * {{USS|Cecil J. Doyle|DE-368}}, a [[John C. Butler class destroyer escort|''John C. Butler''-class]] [[destroyer escort]] from 1944-46. Named for USMC aviator Lt. [[Cecil J. Doyle]], posthumous recipient of the [[Navy Cross]] for heroism during 18 to 25 October 1942 in the [[Solomon Islands campaign]]. * {{USS|Doyle|FFG-39}}, an [[Oliver Hazard Perry class frigate|''Oliver Hazard Perry''-class]] guided missile [[frigate]] from 1983 to 2011. Named for Vice Admiral [[James Henry Doyle]]. {{Shipindex}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Doyle}} [[Category:United States Navy ship names]]
